conclusion: Determine the time of flight from the platform to the ground
Motorcycle leaves the platform with a horizontal velocity v = 3 m/s and lands on the ground after falling a vertical distance of 0.8 m
Using the kinematic equation for vertical motion: y = (1/2) g t^2 where y = 0.8 m and g = 10 m/s^2
Solving for t: 0.8 = (1/2) x 10 x t^2
The horizontal distance s is given by: s = v x t where v = 3 m/s and t = 0.4 s
Substituting the values: s = 3 x 0.4 = 1.2 m
The horizontal distance s traveled by the person and the motorcycle from the platform to point A is 1.2 m
